lexUnit.name: flap.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: (for a body part) to move or be moved up and down or from side to side

sentence.text: He stood there , shouting along and flapping his arms round like an over-excited seagull .
I 'm trying to flap my arms like a duck and quack at the same time .
They stamped their feet and flapped their arms around their bodies to try to keep out the extreme chill .
He flapped his arms against the long , dark coat he wore .
As soon as it entered the fallow he began an excited scream of view halloa , halloa ! and flapped his arms .
He squawked and flapped his arms , and she slapped his leg .
She flung herself on Wexford , yelping frenetically , and when he pushed her away , ran round him in circles , wildly gyrating her tail and flapping her knitted ears .
The soldier idly flapped his hand towards our car .
Henry flapped his hand at his brother .
Googol flapped a hand languidly .
Connors flapped a hand deprecatingly .
` We need someone to do some -- " he flapped his hand inarticulately ` -- translating , or whatever you call it . "
` Sshh , " said Sam again , flapping her hand imperatively .
The head flaps his right hand .
Mark flaps a hand at Babur , shooing him away .
Bernice flapped a hand at him in dismissal , so casually that her jewellery hardly rattled .
Sighing , Frere flapped his hands at his sides like a seal .
Daddy sits there flapping his wings and squawking while mummy builds a new house .
Instead of risking an attack on the predator that is approaching the nest , the parent bird sometimes runs awkwardly away , flapping its wings as if in difficulties .
The mallards shook the water from their feathers and flapped their wings angrily .
Just then several swans began flapping their wings and hissing .
The ducks gazed thoughtfully at the sky and flapped their wings , but not so much as a peep was uttered by any of them .

Young albatrosses on the Leeward Islands spend many days flapping their wings to exercise their muscles and develop their strength , but when they launch themselves into the air , they have to get it right first time .
When he flapped his stumpy wings and heaved his fat body up above the topmost branches , Cassowary was as pleased as pie .
Cranston 's great fat hands flapped like the wings of a wounded bird and Athelstan saw the hurt in his eyes .
For several minutes I pull and give line in turn as the fish sulks and flaps its tail at the surface .
Startled , Tal flew from his perch straight past her head , swerving at the last moment , flapping a wing in her face .
Rooks protested the disturbance by flapping angrily up from the roadside .
Dusky wings flapped overhead .
A butterfly was flapping around the wheelbarrow looking for a fragrance to match the colour of that great metallic flower .
Gulls flapped around uttering their strange cry of ` Tero , Tero " , and swooping down to scavenge whenever play moved on .
` You should n't speak like that to Ocker , " she would declaim , false eyelashes flapping in time with her false loyalty , ` he works terribly hard for us .
The bat flapped around his misshapen hat and took off into the dark .
At the end of one particularly painful lesson , Miss Hatherby did release them and they stalked the room stiffly , pecking at the furniture and flapping their wings , to Constance 's great delight .
Just then several swans began flapping their wings and hissing .
When he flapped his stumpy wings and heaved his fat body up above the topmost branches , Cassowary was as pleased as pie .
